sentences.english: In the happy forest I will forever dwell.
sentences.chinese: 在快活林，我将永远停留。

sentences.english: We were all affected by the vivacity of this lovely little boy.
sentences.chinese: 这个可爱的小男孩的快活使我们都受到感染。

sentences.english: Dammit sir, it's your duty to get married. You can't be always living for pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 该死，先生，结婚是你的职责，你不能总是逍遥快活。

sentences.english: The children seem particularly chirpy today.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们今天好象特别快活。

sentences.english: Whenever I wear skate shoes, slip on the road happy, the heart particularly happy.
sentences.chinese: 每当我穿着滑冰鞋在路上快活的滑时，心里特别高兴。

sentences.english: And mony a canty day, john.
And our vivacious, playful Cassis Rose fragrance just radiates bliss.
sentences.chinese: 活泼可人的黑莓玫瑰香氛散发着无比快活的气息。

sentences.english: The poor man at last was eased and hence lived happily.
sentences.chinese: 这个可怜的人终于安下心来，快快活活地过日子了。

sentences.english: 'Of course, ' said Angel cheerfully, looking round for the mead.
sentences.chinese: “当然不会，”安琪尔快活地说，回头去找蜜酒。

sentences.english: I bet I'll have a gay time.
sentences.chinese: 我敢说我会快活得像活神仙。

sentences.english: The boy is prattling happily in his cot.
sentences.chinese: 那幼儿在小床上呀呀自语，快活得很。

sentences.english: Oh, I think he 's quite a jolly person wearing a large hat.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我想他是一个相当快活的人，戴一顶大帽子。

sentences.english: After the lightning the sunlight slightly delighted us in the flight.
sentences.chinese: 闪电过后，阳光使我们在飞行中稍感快活。

sentences.english: Yeah. Like, if they were basically an optimistic, jovial person…
sentences.chinese: 对，比如说，如果他们原本就是乐观快活的人。

sentences.english: Alexander listened attentively to what was said to him, and bending his head smiled amiably .
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大用心地听他说话，低下头，快活地微微一笑。

sentences.english: Our manager at the restaurant where I worked was a much beloved, jovial man.
sentences.chinese: 我工作的那家餐厅的经理是个又可爱又快活的人。

definition: free and at leisure (idiom); unfettered/outside the reach of the law (of criminal)/at large
delighted/to one's heart's content/straightforward/also pr. [tong4 kuai5]
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
